availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 10

body.p:
Head-Quarters Department of the Ohio,
Cincinnati, Ohio, Nov 24th 1863.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 438. }

4 " " " Sergeant Charles H. Harris, Co "K" 105th Infantry Ohio Volunteers, is discharged the service, to date from the 24th day of November 1863, to enable him to accept a Commission then tendered him by the Governor of Kentucky and since when he has been acting in the capacity of a Commissioned Officer.

By Order of Major General Burnside.
R. Morrow
Assistant Adjutant General.

105 Inft Ohio Vols
Charles H. harris
Discharge
